question: What is a significant component?
a: A component financially significant to the group (i.e. size)
b: A component unlikely to include significant risks of material misstatement of the group financial statements due to its specific nature or circumstances (i.e. specific risks)

question: Why is the concept of a significant component important?

question: What work should auditors do for financially significant components?
a: Perform an audit of the financial information of the component using component materiality.
b: Perform an audit of the non-financial information of the component using component materiality

question: What is not part of the work auditors should do for risk-based significant components?
a: An audit of the financial information of the component using component materiality.
b: An audit of one or more account balances, classes of transactions or disclosures relating to the likely significant risks of material misstatement of the group financial statements
c: An audit of one or more account balances, classes of transactions or disclosures by the company's competitors and their risk mitigation strategies
d: Specified audit procedures relating to the likely significant risks of material misstatement of the group financial statements
